name: Michael Chapman
title: Director of Photography
bio: Oscar-winning pioneer. Known for gritty urban cinematography and psychological depth. Worked with legendary directors including Martin Scorsese. Defined the look of 1970s-80s American cinema.

signature_look.description: Gritty, raw urban realism with psychological intensity. High contrast black and white sensibilities in color. Stark lighting that creates mood through shadow. Naturalistic yet psychologically charged cinematography.
signature_look.key_characteristic: Urban grittiness as psychological landscape. Every shadow conveys meaning. Cinematography expresses moral and psychological state.
signature_look.legendary_technique: Pioneer of high-contrast urban cinematography; master of using lighting to externalize character psychology

film_stock_emulation.name: Kodak Vision3 500T - High Contrast
film_stock_emulation.characteristics: High contrast, gritty grain, desaturated with mood accents

technical_specialties.lighting_approach: High contrast with motivated sources. Strong shadows as character device. Practical urban lighting. Psychological lighting that reflects character state.
technical_specialties.color_science: Desaturated urban palette. High contrast between light and shadow. Colors that feel naturalistic yet emotionally charged.
technical_specialties.exposure_philosophy: Expose for skin tones, let shadows fall dark. Use highlights strategically. Grain as psychological texture.

director_collaboration.communication_style: Direct, gritty collaboration. Focuses on psychological truth over technical beauty.
director_collaboration.strengths_with_narrative: Externalizes character psychology through lighting. Makes audiences feel urban danger and moral complexity through visual language.

technical_mandates: Kodak film stock emulation with contrast
